document.docAuthor: Zhang, Jianshuang, Yu, Hao & Li, Shuqiang
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic studies on the sac spider genus Clubiona (Araneae, Clubionidae) from Xishuangbanna Rainforest, China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic studies on the sac spider genus Clubiona (Araneae, Clubionidae) from Xishuangbanna Rainforest, China

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Guizhou Normal University, Guiyang, Guizhou, China
School of Biological Sciences, Guizhou Education University, Guiyang, Guizhou, China

subSubSection.paragraph: Tolophus Thorell, 1891: 26 (type species T. submaculatus Thorell, 1891).
See Mikhailov (1990) and Yu et al. (2017a) .

A list of the species of the
Clubiona japonica
group was provided by Yu et al. (2017a) . Combined with new taxonomic data in the present paper, we provide an updated list (Table 5 ).

Japoniona
Mikhailov,1990 was described to accommodate the
Clubiona japonica
group. Later, the subgenus Japoniona Japoniona was synonymised by Deeleman-Reinhold (2001) with
Clubiona
. A long-forgotten genus,
Tolophus
Thorell, 1891: 26 (type species
T. submaculatus
Thorell, 1891, belonging to the
Clubiona japonica
group), is currently considered a junior synonym of
Clubiona
. The monophyly of the group is supported by morphological characters and molecular data (pers. obs.). However, the exact placement of the group within
Clubiona
or Clubionidae remains to be investigated using integrative taxonomy.
Tolophus
should perhaps be removed from synonymy with
Clubiona
.
